intro: Nautilocalyx orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco nautilocalyx, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in riverine forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
